text: What a great last week of mid 2020~ Attending virtual # RECOMB2020 and connect with great peoples there, recording my first # SARSCoV2 poster presentation on @ iscb # ISMB2020 virtual conference # COVID19 track, several final reports and GRANT PROPOSAL DEADLINE!!! # phdlife
Proud to see someone ( @ amatur_r ) from my undergrad university (BUET, Bangladesh) getting the best paper award at @ recomb2020. https://twitter.com/RayanChikhi/status/1276562005726560256 …

Attending # RECOMB2020 online reminded me how valuable it is to have access to all the talks. For those interested in my talk on strain-aware assembly of genomes from mixed samples, it’s available here: https://youtu.be/QWT9QSvlxEQ . (1/6)
Congratulations to both of you @ pashadag, @ amatur_r!
Congratulations @ amatur_r !
Giving a talk at a virtual conference while being quarantined in a hotel is a quite surreal experience # RECOMB2020
Congratulations! Well deserved!
Awesome - congrats @ amatur_r !
Thanks Rayan # RECOMB2020
Well done :O

Congratulations to @ pashadag and @ amatur_r for winning the best paper at @ recomb2020 for their paper on k-mer set representation! https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.01.07.896928v2 …pic.twitter.com/5yWiifQ8TR
# RECOMB2020

Variants enriched in bottlenecked population (e.g. Finland) compared to non-bottlenecked populations as a proxy for variant deleteriousness. Variants enriched in Finland are more likely to be genome-wide significant in GWAS. @ konradjk # RECOMB2020-genetics

Indeed! And the shared insights on the centromere enigmas were very inspiring! Exactly what I need right now Thank you Pr. Pavel Pevzner! # RECOMB2020 https://twitter.com/hajirasouliha/status/1275801638872154112 …pic.twitter.com/f7RP1VrbsB
Awesome thank you!

Very exciting talks by @ benjraphael and @ james_y_zou @ UCLA_CGSI @ recomb2020 about computer vision/spatio-temporal genomics and single-cell allele-specific CN aberrations! Hopefully, we can apply these amazing approaches to specific questions in conservation genomics in the future
So excited to share the science @ recomb2020 https://twitter.com/jeriscience/status/1276264438639673344 …
Thanks for the great talks at the virtual @ DR_E_A_M special session on single cells @ recomb2020 @ WumingG @ irepan_salvador @ saezlab @ AttilaGbr # RECOMB2020 pic.twitter.com/vx8CeOaam5

# RECOMB2020 participants; remember, when RECOMB ends, the fun doesn’t! Stick around (virtually) for # RECOMBSEQ2020 June 26 and 27th. We have a great program : https://www.recomb2020.org/recomb-seq-satellites … with keynotes by Paola Bonizzoni and @ ZaminIqbal!

PWAS:Proteome-association study. Combine genotype data with knowledge on protein function to develop gene function scores based on how an individual's variants affects protein function. Look for association between score and phenotype @ BrandesNadav # RECOMB2020
Check out our latest work with @ IliaMinkin # RECOMB2020 https://twitter.com/IliaMinkin/status/1276179485109489666 …

Very interesting! Gene prioritization without using in-sample data. Significant genes identified this way are much more likely to be in the reported" column in GWAS catalog. @ robertpaulbrown # RECOMB2020-genetics"
Hypothesis: More deleterious variants on down-regulated haplotypes compared to up-regulated haplotypes (up-regulated vs down-regulated obtained from eQTL data) # RECOMB2020-genetics
@ Rbaltman on now @ recomb2020 on why ancestry matters for your reactions to drugs. 14% of people predicted to have unusual reaction to ibuprofen pic.twitter.com/U0RFUMpiC5
Analysis of UKBiobank data suggests that each individual has on average of 12 drugs for which unusual response might be expected # RECOMB2020
Pharmacogenetics: variation in drug response due to genetic differences" # RECOMB2020"
# RECOMB2020 organizers, will we be able to get/download the recordings of the talks afterwards (when authors agreed)?

Happy after giving a summary talk in # RECOMB2020 on the @ AllenInstitute @ DR_E_A_M challenge on cell lineage reconstruction! It has been great to collaborate in this DREAM challenge!!pic.twitter.com/kG5nFHW1Tn

@ leon_anavy on now @ recomb2020 . Not # computationalbiology, but biological computation. Storing info in DNA . Exciting field that is making serious strides in recent years.pic.twitter.com/6MdSjCrF1m

Speedup trajectory inference and detection of cell types in # singlecell RNA-Seq with new # method Sphetcher https://bit.ly/384Fabl , # bioinformatics @ StefanCanzar @ RECOMB2020 @ RECOMBseq # Editor @ tonzanipic.twitter.com/NGAWpbiISZ
Bioinformatics tweeps! Anyone have a recording of Pavel Pevzner's talk at # RECOMB2020 yesterday? I got distracted by work and couldn't tune in. Please RT!

So glad I had a chance to listen to the great talk by Pavel Pevzner at # RECOMB2020 yesterday, about the Flye assembly algorithm introducing the concept of disjointigs, more in their paper: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41587-019-0072-8 …

tomorrow I am giving a talk on our latest advancements on popgen estimates from NGS data at the ongoing # RECOMB2020 as part of the genetics satellite meeting, it's free and online! https://www.recomb2020.org/recomb-genetics

I am going to give a talk today at @ recomb2020. It is about our work on a new epistasis test prioritization algorithm. Time: 2:20pm EST & 9:20pm (TR). It will be broadcasted online. You can access with free registration at http://recomb2020.org

hmmm # RECOMB2020-genetics is starting in < 9hrs and I still haven't gotten my zoom link to join the conference. The email receipt for registration doesn't have a contact email... has anyone gotten their link to join?

I enjoy how at virtual conferences there is only a 20 min lunch break # RECOMBGen or how they don't even bother with a lunch break (except 2hrs on Thurs) @ RECOMB2020. I didn't even notice till today and when is lunch time across time zones? Academics only need coffee.

Why do Computational Biologists not use ML? Is it just because it is a Blackbox? Today's panel discussion on the Future of Algorithms in Biology with @ BenLangmead, @ OlgaTroyanskaya, @ OrensteinYaron,Caroline Uhler, @ jeanphi_vert was surely interesting. @ recomb2020 # MachineLearning
Is it too late for people to register for @ recomb2020 -genetics? I know someone trying to get in late.
Great talk at # RECOMB2020!! Interesting data on ALS cell-free DNA methylation
After listening to The Future of Algorithms in Biology at # RECOMB2020 panel talk, I feel like I should learn good old C and get more into the fancy new deep learning. Also Images...

Some thoughts of panel session # RECOMB2020: * Regarding the over-fitting problem, I think we have several problem like small sample size, data structure, and objective function, etc), which one is the we need to resolve and we can solve right now? (1/3)
Watching # RECOMB2020 The Future of Algorithms in Biology panel on my phone. I really hope this level of accesibility becomes the norm for all future events pic.twitter.com/clLKTwEhCu
Panel Discussion: The Future of Algorithms in Biology is streaming live @ recomb2020 # RECOMB2020

Great keynote talk @ recomb2020 by Pavel Pevzner. Describing SPAdes and Flye assembly tools for short and long reads. Also featuring our BiosyntheticSPAdes tool led by the incomparable @ cbm_student Dmitrii Meleshko @ meleshko_dapic.twitter.com/ZS0IIBfkb6
Great talk by Jasmijn Baaijens about vg-flow to resolve quasi-species for virus study!! https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/645721v3 … # RECOMB2020
I am missing all of them this week.
which ones have available archives?
These are the conferences" that are interesting to me and some of my colleagues this week: @ uk_biobank Science Meeting, @ recomb2020, @ SparkAISummit, and maybe more."
# RECOMB2020 sequencing and assembly session is on-going now. While it is a bless to be able to listen to the talks at home, it is also hard to switch the context from regular work.

Very grateful to # recomb2020 for going virtual, it has given me the opportunity to watch a conference I otherwise most likely would not have been able to prioritize. Just had the pleasure of listening to a great talk from Pavel Pevzner!
# RECOMB2020 from the balcony. pic.twitter.com/OVhv6VkmIN
Pavel Pevzner just threw some serious shade at @ recomb2020 in his keynote today: 8 yeas ago we were rejected and if they accepted it, it would have been the most cited paper in recomb history...""

Listening to Pavel Pevzner's exciting keynote talk at # RECOMB2020: who knew that proteins (peptides) occurred in circular form? And that these circular peptides make excellent antibiotics? Biology never fails to surprise, and Pavel always tells a compelling story
Great talk by one of the greatest bioinformaticians Pavel Pevzner @ recomb2020, who btw was introduced by none other than Michael Waterman himself. pic.twitter.com/ZP5y2f67Og
Algorithms day ahead in @ recomb2020. Looking forward to chairing a session in 7 hours from now. https://www.recomb2020.org/program

For those interested in # genomics and population # genetics, there's an online conference happening tomorrow and Friday # RECOMB2020 Registration is free here https://www.recomb2020.org/recomb-genetics
@ recomb2020 I missed the CCB conference too. Any recordings or resources available? # RECOMB2020
Excited that our d-PBWT paper will be presented tomorrow morning, following a keynote from my PhD advisor Pavel Pevzner! # RECOMB2020

The online # RECOMB2020 is great. I just gave a talk to 450 people - the largest audience I'd given a talk to by a fair margin! On spectral jaccard similarity. https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/800581v2 …https://twitter.com/recomb2020/status/1273629235261906944 …

Tomorrow (Wed Jun 24) at 4pm ET (10pm Italy time), # RECOMB2020 will have the Epigenetics" session (https://www.recomb2020.org/program ). @ RuochiZhang in my group will present his @ recomb2020 "MATCHA" paper (also @ CellSystemsCP). Look forward to your feedback.https://www.cell.com/cell-systems/fulltext/S2405-4712(20)30147-2 …"
Great network biology talks today at # recomb2020
Really nice talk assessing methods for detecting network modules with GWAS data @ ftsven # RECOMB2020. Here is the paper: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41592-019-0509-5 …

Had a great time (virtually) presenting the results from our most recent pre-print today more details on how we used # tSNE to predict the # 3Dgenome for # FissionYeast can be found here: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.01.28.923615v1 … # RECOMB2020 # Bioinformaticspic.twitter.com/KzQMqF3P4f
Back at # RECOMB2020 with some networks. Very fitting for my current interests.

Also, I’m giving a highlight talk on Disease Module Identification at # RECOMB2020 today at 4pm US Eastern time (10pm CET) that is streamed online: https://whova.com/portal/webapp/recom_202005/Agenda/1041308/ …
First @ recomb2020-Seq talk from @ MangulLab will be presented by @ nlapier2 Saturday, June 27, 2020 at 10:15-11:45am sessionhttps://twitter.com/MangulLab/status/1275133826159656960 …

Enjoying the keynote of @ recomb2020 right now - learned that # COVID was carried to humans from bats via... wait for it... the anteater.

Excited for our # RECOMB2020 talk on Computing the Rearrangement Distance of Natural Genomes today at 4:40 PM CET. Paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2001.02139 , Joint work with Leonhard Bohnenkämper, Marília D. V. Braga, and @ jensstoye

Will be presenting some recent work on identifying altered subnetworks at 3:40pm (EST) today at the virtual # RECOMB2020 conference (free registration!) Register here: https://www.recomb2020.org/registration https://twitter.com/benjraphael/status/1219650999901720583 …
Really enjoying virtual # RECOMB2020 and some interesting network analysis talks coming up later today. Free to register here: https://www.recomb2020.org/

# RECOMB2020 normally at this time I was happy and drinking cocktails with other attendees. Now I'm following talks with a glass of wine...let's see in the long run which approach is better :)

Thank you to the organizers and attendees of # RECOMB2020 for their attention and questions! Many asked for the code, and it’s hosted on Songwei Ge’s (lead author) GitHub: https://github.com/SongweiGe/scDGN

Following the single cell sessions at # RECOMB2020 . I got to say this conference has really stepped up the virtual conference game! I am really enjoying the interesting talks as well as the networking and discussion possibilities.

Lisa Tucker-Kellogg presenting TRANSCOMPP at # RECOMB2020 Understanding phenotypic plasticity by estimating Markov transition rates for cell state transitions @ OUPBioinfohttps://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/bioinformatics/article-abstract/36/9/2813/5714733#.XvEJ5kbM2HU.twitter …
If you are having trouble getting audio in the # RECOMB2020 sessions, try using a private / incognito tab. Not exactly sure why this works, but it did.

# RECOMB2020 starts today with an exciting program and more than 3300 registered attendees (you can still register here https://www.recomb2020.org/registration !) Let us know what are your favorite moments through our official hashtag # RECOMB2020 !
looking forward to hearing your talk! # RECOMB2020 https://twitter.com/pepeb_5/status/1274991316867461125 …

Interested in single cell mutations analysis and/or clustering? If you're joining @ recomb2020 today, definitely tune in for this presentation, amazing piece of work! # RECOMB2020 https://twitter.com/pepeb_5/status/1274991316867461125 …

Really happy to have the opportunity to give a talk at # RECOMB2020 today. I will present the work Nico Borgsmüler and I have performed on a new method to cluster single cell mutation profiles. Stay tuned at 10 pm (EET)! @ bbglab @ cbg_ethz @ IRBBarcelonahttps://bit.ly/38138Vb

And it is a wonderful completely new experience so far.. Even before the actual beginning of the event # VirtualConference via the @ WhovaSupport app is just wow Thank you @ recomb2020 https://twitter.com/recomb2020/status/1273629235261906944 …
